title: Facebook Asks Court To Intervene In EU Antitrust Probe Over Violation Of Employee Privacy: FT
text: Facebook Inc. (NASDAQ: FB) is asking the General Court in Luxembourg to intervene in the European Union's antitrust investigation against the company on grounds of violating the privacy of its employees, according to a Financial Times report Monday.

title: Big tech set to face Congress Wednesday ahead of reporting quarterly earnings on Thursday
text: s tech giants Amazon, Alphabet, Apple and Facebook are set to report earnings this week, many investors are curious how their CEO’s testimonies on Capitol Hill will impact earnings and their share of their markets.

title: Brazil antitrust watchdog questions Facebook's WhatsApp payment fees
text: Brazil's antitrust watchdog is asking Facebook Inc to explain the fee structure for its short-lived payments service launched in June in partnership with card processor Cielo SA , according to a document seen by Reuters.

title: Bezos, Cook, Pichai, Zuckerberg set to testify before Congress on Wednesday
text: Basecamp co-founder and CTO David Heinemeier talks to FOX Business’ Liz Claman about Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg, Apple CEO Tim Cook and Google CEO Sundar Pichai testifying before Congress on Wednesday.

title: Facebook Delays Q2 Results Release
text: The company's CEO has a date with Congress on the originally scheduled release day.

title: Amazon, Apple & Facebook Earnings: Buy Big-Tech Stocks Despite Pullback Fears?
text: Ben Rains dives into what to expect from Amazon, Apple, and Facebook’s upcoming quarterly earnings results.

title: Tech’s top CEOs will face Congress in antitrust hearing now set for Wednesday
text: A rare public showdown between Congress and the CEOs of tech’s biggest companies is still on track after being postponed last week. The House Judiciary Committee hearing, originally set for Monday, will now take place Wednesday, July 29 at 12 PM Eastern Time.

title: Final Trades: Seagate Technology, Best Buy, Facebook & more
text: The "Halftime Report" traders give their top picks to watch for the second half.

title: Facebook sues EU antitrust regulator for excessive nature of data requests
text: Facebook is suing EU antitrust regulators for seeking information beyond what is necessary, including highly personal details, for their investigations into the company's data and marketplace, the U.S. social media giant said on Monday.

title: What the antitrust hearings on Capitol Hill means for Big Tech's profits: Analyst
text: Peter Choi, Vontobel Quality Growth Sr. Research Analyst weighs in on what to expect as CEO's of Amazon, Alphabet, Facebook and Apple head to Capitol Hill for antitrust hearings.

title: Will Facebook's (FB) E-commerce Push Benefit Q2 Earnings?
text: Facebook's (FB) second-quarter 2020 results are likely to reflect sluggish ad revenues. However, the company's e-commerce push and growing adoption of AR devices is likely to aid revenues.

title: How Well Has FB Handled The Pandemic And Ad Boycott? Q2 Earnings Ahead
text: The adage when it rains, it pours, has some analysts wondering when Facebook (FB) CEO Mark Zuckerberg might be pulling out an umbrella, considering how hard it looks like it’s been pouring on his parade in recent weeks.

title: Tech stocks have been in a bit of a bubble, investment manager says
text: Richard Harris, chief executive at Port Shelter Investment Management, says tech stocks have been in a bit of a bubble.

title: You could breakup Facebook, you could probably breakup all of them: Caleb Silver
text: Caleb Silver, Investopedia Editor-In-Chief breaks down the latest on Big Tech investing, the hearing on Capitol Hill, and what could happen if these companies were broken up.

title: What to expect from the Big Tech antitrust hearing on Capitol Hill
text: Editor-in-Chief Andy Serwer breaks down the latest on what to expect from the  Big Tech antitrust hearing. CEOs of Amazon, Apple, Google and Facebook are scheduled to testify before The House Judiciary Committee on July 29, 2020.

title: Facebook Earnings Report Rescheduled Due To Shift In Antitrust Hearing
text: Facebook has moved the day of its second quarter earnings report due to a scheduling conflict related to an antitrust hearing. The Facebook earnings report will now be issued on Thursday.

title: Facebook Reschedules Q2 Results To July 30
text: Facebook, Inc. (NASDAQ: FB) said Monday it has changed the date it will release the company's second-quarter 2020 financial results to Thursday, July 30 due to a scheduling conflict.

title: Here's What to Watch When Facebook Reports Earnings on Wednesday
text: The uncertainty surrounding the coronavirus pandemic will make this report an especially important one.

title: Facebook pushes earnings report to Thursday after Big Tech hearing is rescheduled
text: Facebook Inc. FB, +1.50% said Monday that it plans to report second-quarter earnings Thursday instead of Wednesday "due to a scheduling conflict.

title: Facebook delays second-quarter results as Zuckerberg set to appear before Congress
text: Facebook Inc said on Monday it has delayed the release of its second-quarter results by a day to July 30 to allow Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg to appear for a rescheduled Congressional hearing.

title: The world's most powerful tech CEOs are about to testify before Congress
text: When Bill Gates went before Congress 22 years ago to respond to claims that Microsoft was unfairly muscling out its competition, he offered what's since become a familiar Silicon Valley refrain.

title: Apple, Facebook, Amazon, Google are headed to Congress, an event years in the making
text: Silicon Valley faces a reckoning over its dominance.

title: Big Tech Earnings Roll In: 4 Stocks to Watch This Week
text: Facebook, Amazon, Alphabet and Apple account for almost one-fifth of the value of the S&P 500, and have returned nearly 35% this year, while other stocks in the index collectively lost 5%.

title: If Facebook is the new cigarettes, then this is what we must learn from the 1970 TV ad ban
text:
The 1970 ban offers sobering lessons about regulating our newest toxic health problem: social media.
Just before the stroke of midnight on December 31, 1970, Virginia Slims aired a new commercial during The Tonight Show Starring Johnny Carson.

title: Facebook, Amazon, Apple, Google CEOs To Testify Before House Antitrust Subcommittee Wednesday
text: The chief executive officers of four of the largest technology companies in the United States will testify before the House Judiciary Committee on Wednesday as part of the legislators' ongoing antiturst probe, Politico reported.
